text: Manuel Fraga Iribarne (November 23, 1922 in Vilalba â€“ January 15, 2012 in Madrid) was a Spanish and Galician politician. Fraga was a politician in Spain under Francisco Franco's dictatorial regime and in the democracy after Franco's death. He was the President of Galicia from 1990 to 2005 and governed the region strictly with a hard hand. He was loved by those who supported him, and loathed by his opponents. Category:1922 births Category:2012 deaths Category:Presidents of the Regional Government of Galicia
title: Manuel Fraga Iribarne
